questions.text: Who ends up buying the same shirt as Brent?
questions.explanation:
Hank.

	When Brent arrives at work, Wanda compliments Brent on his new shirt and he says that he always picks out the best shirts.  He says that nobody could pick out a better shirt that has the style and comfort of his new purchase when Hank walks into the store with the same shirt.

questions.text: In the beginning of the episode whose funeral are Emma and Oscar attending?
questions.explanation:
Sparky's.

	Oscar assumed that Sparky was dead long before the funeral, but Emma suggests that he's thinking of Slim, his other brother.  The third brother, Clark, is at the funeral, and Emma and Oscar point out that he has really big teeth.  Oscar says that the cheap coffin at the funeral made him depressed.

questions.text: Who decides to start a pilates class?
questions.explanation:
Lacey.

	Lacey tells Brent that she's been feeling depressed when he talks to her over coffee, and she says that she started pilates before moving from Toronto.  He suggests that she start a class and she's hesitant because she's no good at public speaking, but she finally decides to do it.

questions.text: How long has Oscar been building the same bookshelf?
questions.explanation:
Thirteen years.

	Oscar tells Emma that he has a way with tools and she says that she married one.  When she points out that he's still working on the bookshelf, he says that he could've build it fast, but he's building it right.  Oscar decides he's going to build his own coffin rather than be buried in an expensive, yet shoddy coffin.

questions.text: What is the model of the coffin that Oscar plans to build for himself?
questions.explanation:
The Infinity King.

	When Lacey asks if Oscar wants to try a pilates class, the subject quickly changes to coffins and he goes over the fine details of the craftsmanship on the coffin.  Lacey points out that he'll be dead when he uses it, and he says that he can't wait.

questions.text: What word on the pilates flyer was placed within quotation marks?
questions.explanation:
Free.

	Lacey begins spreading flyers around Dog River and when she approaches Wanda and Brent, Wanda tries to prevent the flyer from being posted.  She explains that although Lacey meant to put quotations around the word 'Free' or emphasis, it makes it look like there's some kind of trick behind the pilates class.

questions.text: When Oscar dreams about his funeral, who is not attending it?
questions.explanation:
Wanda.

	During the dream, Oscar is in his coffin and the other three are just realizing that Oscar was right about everything he's ever done and that they've always been wrong.  They also point out the top notch craftsmanship on the coffin before saying goodbye.  Oscar wakes up and realizes that he's making the object he'll be buried in and he runs away.

questions.text: What is the name of the bartender at the Dog River Hotel?
questions.explanation:
Paul.

	When Lacey goes to the hotel bar, she tells Brent that the class didn't go too well because Davis was the only one who attended the class.  Brent suggests that Lacey give the class some time and people will join it.  When he asks if Davis enjoyed the class, she says that she thinks he did.  The truth is that the next day, Davis' muscles were so sore that he couldn't even drive the police car.

Wanda.

	When Brent asks what pilates really is, he realizes that it's the same as Wanda's 'Mat Class' which teaches the same things.  Lacey realizes that Wanda was so angry about her idea because she would be a rival class.

questions.text: Does Oscar ever finish making the coffin?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Instead of finishing the coffin, Oscar makes a bookshelf out of it.  When he and Emma decide to try it out, pieces begin to break off of it.  Meanwhile, Brent and Hank stop fighting about their new shirts when Karen and Lacey point out that they're actually women's blouses.  In the end, their comfy new shirts are used as rags.
